summary: The 100-meter dash is a popular sprint race in track and field. It's the shortest common outdoor running distance at 109.36 yards. Both men and women have competed in this event at the Olympics since 1896 and 1928, respectively. Runners start from blocks and aim to reach their top speed, typically between 50 to 60 meters. The men's world record is 9.58 seconds by Usain Bolt, while the women's is 10.49 seconds by Florence Griffith-Joyner. The "world's fastest person" title often goes to the Olympic 100-meter champion.
title: 100 metres
